article: It took Peter quite a while to find a place for his car, and in the end he had to  _  it on a small street, a few minutes away from the dentist's. As he got out, he looked at his watch. He would meet the dentist at five and he  _  had half an hour. He walked into the square and sat down in a chair, to  _  the falling sun. As he sat there, he  _  the children playing. He was  _  to see a red car like his own come out of the street where he had parked. The car moved  _  and soon disappeared . Peter felt in his pockets for his keys, but they were not there. "My car!" he shouted in a loud  _  . He got up and ran out of the square, then down the small street. He couldn't see his car at first, and then he found it was  behind  a larger one, with the keys on the roof of his car. By the time he got to the dentist's, it was after five. "A very strange thing  _  to me," he said to the dentist to explain why. "Don't  _  about that," said the dentist. "I just got here myself."
